{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child is severely dehydrated with weak pulse and unrecordable blood pressure, indicating a critical condition that requires immediate intervention. Repeated attempts at gaining intravenous (IV) access have failed. According to Document [2], the bone marrow is a vascular tissue which cannot collapse, and it may be used as a vascular access to treat life-threatening emergencies especially in children. Intraosseous infusion was decided as a last ditch procedure in the cases reported. Document [4] also mentions a case where a child in hypovolemic shock required intraosseous (IO) needle placement when IV access could not be obtained. Therefore, the next best step would be to administer intraosseous IV fluids.", "answer_choice": "C"}
